Using Git and GitHub

Some guidelines for using Git and GitHub in the DevOps class (and perhaps in other, future classes as well).

  • For the purposes of continuous integration, work should usually be done on the master branch. Creating other branches should be done only in extraordinary circumstances.
  • Use real commit messages that give someone viewing the commit an idea of what occurred.
    Bad: "Updated a file."
    Good: "Started work on git page and added section on commit messages."
